getCardOpeningArg
The function allows determining the parameters for opening the screen form.:
opening method (in a new/current tab or in a modal window);
visual instance
ID.
The function returns an object of the CardOpeningArg class.
Syntax
getCardOpeningArg
()
No parameters.
Note
When selecting the
getCardOpeningArg
function from the "Forms" tab, the following structure is inserted into the algorithm code:
def cardOpeningArg = getCardOpeningArg()
if (isNotNull(cardOpeningArg)) {
def cardOpeningMode = cardOpeningArg.getOpeningMode()
def cardOpeningVisualId = cardOpeningArg.getVisualId()
if (cardOpeningMode.isTab() and cardOpeningVisualId = 100500) {
// ...
}
}
The
getCardOpeningArg
function gets an instance of the CardOpeningArg class. By default, the received instance is assigned to the cardOpeningArg variable.
The following methods are used when working with the function:
Method
Purpose
getOpeningMode
Returns an instance of the CardOpeningMode class. The following methods are used when working with the function:
isTab – returns a boolean value that determines the opening of an object in a new/current tab;
isModal – returns a boolean value that defines the opening of an object in a modal window.
getVisualId
Returns the xref code:visual.adoc#ekz[instance visual].
Use case
Assume the user is required to configure the System depending on the way the client’s application is opened:
when opening in a new/current tab, consider that the application has been accepted for work – change the status of the application to "Doing", appoint the current employee as the responsible;
if the application is open in a modal window, the status and responsible employee of the application should not change.
To do this, set up the
